paragraphs.text: I Desired, when in Orphanene,[fn-60-P6074_1911051:2-nf] to see your excellency; I had also hoped that while you were living at Corsagaena, there would have been nothing to hinder your coming to me at a synod which I had expected to hold at Attagaena; since, however, I failed to hold it, my desire was to see you in the bill-country; for here again Evesus,[fn-60-P6075_1911414:3-nf] being in that neighbourhood, held out hopes of our meeting. But since I have been disappointed on both occasions, I determined to write and beg that you would deign to visit me; for I think it is but right and proper that the young man should come to the old. Furthermore, at our meeting, I would make you a tender of my advice, touching your negotiations with certain at Caesarea: a right conclusion of the matter calls for my intervention. If agreeable then, do not be backward in coming to me.

references.text: A district in Armenia Minor. Ramsay, Hist. Geog. A.M. 314.
cf. Ep. ccli. p. 291. Euassai or Evesus is about fifty miles north of Caesarea.
